front.title: Using a Single IPv4 Global Address in DSTM

abstract.t: This document specifies an enhanced dual stack mechanism used in DSTM[1] by adding a new DHCPv6 option which provides a method to assign a single IPv4 global address with TCP/UDP port range to all dual stack hosts in DSTM domain instead of dynamic IPv4 global address allocation. This enhancement to DSTM will result in a more efficient mechanism to allow IPv4/IPv6 hosts to communicate with IPv4 only hosts using a single IPv4 global address only.
